WYSIWYM.testclasses
Class DescriptionCompiler

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.testclasses.DescriptionCompiler

public class DescriptionCompiler
extends Object

Takes a user name, finds all unregistered users by that name, and returns brief descriptions of them all. This class is used by ourSpaces to generate descriptions of (unregistered) users.

Version:
1.4 October 2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Constructor Summary
DescriptionCompiler()
           
 
Method Summary
 Map<String,String> getDescriptions(String first, String last, boolean registered)
          Takes a person's first and last name, finds any users with (partially) those same names, and generates small descriptions of them that include name, email, organisation, resources written, etc.
 Map<String,String> getNLDescriptions(String name)
          Takes a person's name, finds any users with (partially) the same name, and extracts all information about them from the archive into SemanticGraphs.

Constructor Detail

DescriptionCompiler

public DescriptionCompiler()
Method Detail

getDescriptions

public Map<String,String> getDescriptions(String first,
                                          String last,
                                          boolean registered)
Takes a person's first and last name, finds any users with (partially) those same names, and generates small descriptions of them that include name, email, organisation, resources written, etc. If registered is false, only return unregistered users.

Parameters:
first - First name
last - Last, family name
registered - If false, only return unregistered users.
Returns:
Map with user Sesame ID's and descriptions.

getNLDescriptions

public Map<String,String> getNLDescriptions(String name)
Takes a person's name, finds any users with (partially) the same name, and extracts all information about them from the archive into SemanticGraphs. Then generates feedback texts that only show certain information types (e.g. email, organisation).

Parameters:
name - Username
Returns:
Map with user Sesame ID's and descriptions.
